page.title: 17Ecology_ Urban landscape
page.content: The decline in large scale industry in recent years has led to many physical changes in the landscape. The Black Country, once notorious for air pollution is no longer host to a variety of industries reliant on burning coal. Its mineral wealth has long been exhausted or uneconomic and few traces remain on the surface. Much former factory land is now derelict and supports a wide variety o f fauna and flora. Least evidence is seen in mammals, but foxes, bats and hedgehogs are fairly common. Open spaces like disused railways, canals, and derelict sites support small mammals,wild flowers and associated insects. Birds are plentiful, including kestrels, pied wagtails and greenfinches. Several schools are encouraging wildlife in their grounds.
